project.name: Durandal API
project.description: Durandal is a cross-device, cross-platform client framework written in JavaScript and designed to make Single Page Applications (SPAs) easy to create and maintain.

activator.name: activator
activator.description:
The activator module encapsulates all logic related to screen/component activation.
An activator is essentially an asynchronous state machine that understands a particular state transition protocol.
The protocol ensures that the following series of events always occur: `canDeactivate` (previous state), `canActivate` (new state), `deactivate` (previous state), `activate` (new state).
Each of the _can_ callbacks may return a boolean, affirmative value or promise for one of those. If either of the _can_ functions yields a false result, then activation halts.

app.name: app
app.description: The app module controls app startup, plugin loading/configuration and root visual display.

composition.name: composition
composition.description: The composition module encapsulates all functionality related to visual composition.

events.name: events
events.description:
Durandal events originate from backbone.js but also combine some ideas from signals.js as well as some additional improvements.
Events can be installed into any object and are installed into the `app` module by default for convenient app-wide eventing.

system.name: system
system.description: The system module encapsulates the most basic features used by other modules.

viewEngine.name: viewEngine
viewEngine.description: The viewEngine module provides information to the viewLocator module which is used to locate the view's source file. The viewEngine also transforms a view id into a view instance.

viewLocator.name: viewLocator
viewLocator.description: The viewLocator module collaborates with the viewEngine module to provide views (literally dom sub-trees) to other parts of the framework as needed. The primary consumer of the viewLocator is the composition module.

viewModelBinder.name: viewModelBinder
viewModelBinder.description: The viewLocator module collaborates with the viewEngine module to provide views (literally dom sub-trees) to other parts of the framework as needed. The primary consumer of the viewLocator is the composition module.

dialog.name: dialog
dialog.description: The viewLocator module collaborates with the viewEngine module to provide views (literally dom sub-trees) to other parts of the framework as needed. The primary consumer of the viewLocator is the composition module.

history.name: history
history.description: Abstracts away the low level details of working with browser history and url changes in order to provide a solid foundation for a router.

observable.name: observable
observable.description: Enables automatic observability of plain javascript object for ES5 compatible browsers.

router.name: router
router.description: Connects the history module's url and history tracking support to Durandal's activation and composition engine allowing you to easily build navigation-style applications.

serializer.name: serializer
serializer.description: Serializes and deserializes data to/from JSON.

widget.name: widget
widget.description: Layers the widget sugar on top of the composition system.

Activator.name: Activator
Activator.description: An activator is a read/write computed observable that enforces the activation lifecycle whenever changing values.

Events.name: Events
Events.description: Creates an object with eventing capabilities.

EventsModule.name: EventsModule
EventsModule.description: Creates an object with eventing capabilities.

MessageBox.name: MessageBox
MessageBox.description: Models a message box's message, title and options.

ObservableModule.name: ObservableModule
ObservableModule.description: You can call observable(obj, propertyName) to get the observable function for the specified property on the object.

classitems.description: Activate the hash change handling, returning `true` if the current URL matches an existing route, and `false` otherwise.
classitems.name: activate

return.description: Returns true/false from loading the url unless the silent option was selected.

classitems.description: Disable history, perhaps temporarily. Not useful in a real app, but possibly useful for unit testing Routers.

classitems.description: Checks the current URL to see if it has changed, and if it has, calls `loadUrl`, normalizing across the hidden iframe.

return.description: Returns true/false from loading the url.

classitems.description: Attempts to load the current URL fragment. A pass-through to options.routeHandler.
classitems.name: loadUrl

return.description: Returns true/false from the route handler.

classitems.description:
Save a fragment into the hash history, or replace the URL state if the
'replace' option is passed. You are responsible for properly URL-encoding
the fragment in advance.
The options object can contain `trigger: true` if you wish to have the
route callback be fired (not usually desirable), or `replace: true`, if
you wish to modify the current URL without adding an entry to the history.
classitems.name: navigate

params.name: fragment
params.description: The url fragment to navigate to.

params.name: options
params.description: An options object with optional trigger and replace flags. You can also pass a boolean directly to set the trigger option.

return.description: Returns true/false from loading the url.

classitems.description: The function that will be called back when the fragment changes.
classitems.name: routeHandler

classitems.description: The url root used to extract the fragment when using push state.
classitems.name: root

classitems.description: Use hash change when present.
classitems.name: hashChange

classitems.description: Use push state when present.
classitems.name: pushState

classitems.description: Prevents loading of the current url when activating history.
classitems.name: silent

classitems.description: The name of the callback parameter to inject into jsonp requests by default.
classitems.name: callbackParam

classitems.description: Makes an HTTP GET request.
classitems.name: get

params.name: url
params.description: The url to send the get request to.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional key/value object to transform into query string parameters.

return.description: A promise of the get response data.

classitems.description: Makes an JSONP request.
classitems.name: jsonp

params.name: url
params.description: The url to send the get request to.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional key/value object to transform into query string parameters.

params.name: callbackParam
params.description: The name of the callback parameter the api expects (overrides the default callbackParam).

return.description: A promise of the response data.

classitems.description: Makes an HTTP POST request.
classitems.name: post

params.name: url
params.description: The url to send the post request to.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to post. It will be converted to JSON. If the data contains Knockout observables, they will be converted into normal properties before serialization.

return.description: A promise of the response data.

classitems.description: Converts an entire object into an observable object by re-writing its attributes using ES5 getters and setters. Attributes beginning with '_' or '$' are ignored.
classitems.name: convertObject

params.name: obj
params.description: The target object to convert.

classitems.description: Converts a normal property into an observable property using ES5 getters and setters.
classitems.name: convertProperty

params.name: obj
params.description: The target object on which the property to convert lives.

params.name: propertyName
params.description: The name of the property to convert.

params.name: original
params.description: The original value of the property. If not specified, it will be retrieved from the object.

classitems.description: Defines a computed property using ES5 getters and setters.
classitems.name: defineProperty

params.name: obj
params.description: The target object on which to create the property.

params.name: propertyName
params.description: The name of the property to define.

params.name: evaluatorOrOptions
params.description: The Knockout computed function or computed options object.

classitems.description: Installs the plugin into the view model binder's `beforeBind` hook so that objects are automatically converted before being bound.
classitems.name: install

classitems.description: Triggered when the navigation logic has completed.
classitems.name: router:navigation:complete

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated instance.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered when the navigation has been cancelled.
classitems.name: router:navigation:cancelled

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated instance.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered right before a route is activated.
classitems.name: router:route:activating

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated instance.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered right before a route is configured.
classitems.name: router:route:before-config

params.name: config
params.description: The route config.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered just after a route is configured.
classitems.name: router:route:after-config

params.name: config
params.description: The route config.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered when the view for the activated instance is attached.
classitems.name: router:navigation:attached

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated instance.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: Triggered when the composition that the activated instance participates in is complete.
classitems.name: router:navigation:composition-complete

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated instance.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction.

params.name: router
params.description: The router.

classitems.description: The route handlers that are registered. Each handler consists of a `routePattern` and a `callback`.
classitems.name: handlers

classitems.description: The route configs that are registered.
classitems.name: routes

classitems.description: The route configurations that have been designated as displayable in a nav ui (nav:true).
classitems.name: navigationModel

classitems.description: The active item/screen based on the current navigation state.
classitems.name: activeItem

classitems.description: Indicates that the router (or a child router) is currently in the process of navigating.
classitems.name: isNavigating

classitems.description: Parses a query string into an object.
classitems.name: parseQueryString

params.name: queryString
params.description: The query string to parse.

return.description: An object keyed according to the query string parameters.

classitems.description: Add a route to be tested when the url fragment changes.
classitems.name: route

params.name: routePattern
params.description: The route pattern to test against.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute when the route pattern is matched.

classitems.description: Attempt to load the specified URL fragment. If a route succeeds with a match, returns `true`. If no defined routes matches the fragment, returns `false`.
classitems.name: loadUrl

params.name: fragment
params.description: The URL fragment to find a match for.

return.description: True if a match was found, false otherwise.

classitems.description: Updates the document title based on the activated module instance, the routing instruction and the app.title.
classitems.name: updateDocumentTitle

params.name: instance
params.description: The activated module.

params.name: instruction
params.description: The routing instruction associated with the action. It has a `config` property that references the original route mapping config.

classitems.description:
Save a fragment into the hash history, or replace the URL state if the
'replace' option is passed. You are responsible for properly URL-encoding
the fragment in advance.
The options object can contain `trigger: true` if you wish to have the
route callback be fired (not usually desirable), or `replace: true`, if
you wish to modify the current URL without adding an entry to the history.
classitems.name: navigate

params.name: fragment
params.description: The url fragment to navigate to.

params.name: options
params.description: An options object with optional trigger and replace flags. You can also pass a boolean directly to set the trigger option.

return.description: Returns true/false from loading the url.

classitems.description: Navigates back in the browser history.
classitems.name: navigateBack

classitems.description: Converts a route to a hash suitable for binding to a link's href.
classitems.name: convertRouteToHash

classitems.description: Converts a route to a module id. This is only called if no module id is supplied as part of the route mapping.
classitems.name: convertRouteToModuleId

classitems.description: Converts a route to a displayable title. This is only callef if no title is specified as part of the route mapping.
classitems.name: convertRouteToTitle

classitems.description: Maps route patterns to modules.
classitems.name: map

params.name: route
params.description: A route, config or array of configs.

params.name: config
params.description: The config for the specified route.

classitems.description: Builds an observable array designed to bind a navigation UI to. The model will exist in the `navigationModel` property.
classitems.name: buildNavigationModel

params.name: defaultOrder
params.description: The default order to use for navigation visible routes that don't specify an order. The defualt is 100.

classitems.description: Configures how the router will handle unknown routes.
classitems.name: mapUnknownRoutes

params.name: config
params.description:
If not supplied, then the router will map routes to modules with the same name.
If a string is supplied, it represents the module id to route all unknown routes to.
Finally, if config is a function, it will be called back with the route instruction containing the route info. The function can then modify the instruction by adding a moduleId and the router will take over from there.

classitems.description: Resets the router by removing handlers, routes and previously configured options.
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description: Makes all configured routes and/or module ids relative to a certain base url.
classitems.name: makeRelative

params.name: settings
params.description: If string, the value is used as the base for routes and module ids. If an object, you can specify route and/or moduleId separately.

classitems.description: Creates a child router.
classitems.name: createChildRouter

classitems.description: Activates the router and the underlying history tracking mechanism.
classitems.name: activate

return.description: A promise that resolves when the router is ready.

classitems.description: Disable history, perhaps temporarily. Not useful in a real app, but possibly useful for unit testing Routers.
classitems.name: deactivate

classitems.description: Installs the router's custom ko binding handler.
classitems.name: install

classitems.description: The name of the attribute that the serializer should use to identify an object's type.
classitems.name: typeAttribute

classitems.description: The amount of space to use for indentation when writing out JSON.
classitems.name: space

classitems.description: The default replacer function used during serialization. By default properties starting with '_' or '$' are removed from the serialized object.
classitems.name: replacer

params.name: key
params.description: The object key to check.

params.name: value
params.description: The object value to check.

classitems.description: Serializes the object.
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: object
params.description: The object to serialize.

params.name: settings
params.description: Settings can specify a replacer or space to override the serializer defaults.

classitems.description: Gets the type id for an object instance, using the configured `typeAttribute`.
classitems.name: getTypeId

params.name: object
params.description: The object to serialize.

classitems.description: Maps type ids to object constructor functions. Keys are type ids and values are functions.
classitems.name: typeMap.

classitems.description: Adds a type id/constructor function mampping to the `typeMap`.
classitems.name: registerType

params.name: typeId
params.description: The type id.

params.name: constructor
params.description: The constructor.

classitems.description: The default reviver function used during deserialization. By default is detects type properties on objects and uses them to re-construct the correct object using the provided constructor mapping.
classitems.name: reviver

params.name: key
params.description: The attribute key.

params.name: value
params.description: The object value associated with the key.

params.name: getTypeId
params.description: A custom function used to get the type id from a value.

params.name: getConstructor
params.description: A custom function used to get the constructor function associated with a type id.

classitems.description: Deserialize the JSON.
classitems.name: deserialize

params.name: string
params.description: The JSON string.

params.name: settings
params.description: Settings can specify a reviver, getTypeId function or getConstructor function.

classitems.description: Creates a ko binding handler for the specified kind.
classitems.name: registerKind

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind to create a custom binding handler for.

classitems.description: Maps views and module to the kind identifier if a non-standard pattern is desired.
classitems.name: mapKind

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind name.

params.name: viewId
params.description: The unconventional view id to map the kind to.

params.name: moduleId
params.description: The unconventional module id to map the kind to.

classitems.description: Maps a kind name to it's module id. First it looks up a custom mapped kind, then falls back to `convertKindToModulePath`.
classitems.name: mapKindToModuleId

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind name.

classitems.description: Converts a kind name to it's module path. Used to conventionally map kinds who aren't explicitly mapped through `mapKind`.
classitems.name: convertKindToModulePath

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind name.

classitems.description: Maps a kind name to it's view id. First it looks up a custom mapped kind, then falls back to `convertKindToViewPath`.
classitems.name: mapKindToViewId

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind name.

classitems.description: Converts a kind name to it's view id. Used to conventionally map kinds who aren't explicitly mapped through `mapKind`.
classitems.name: convertKindToViewPath

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind name.

classitems.description: Creates a widget.
classitems.name: create

params.name: element
params.description: The DOMElement or knockout virtual element that serves as the target element for the widget.

params.name: settings
params.description: The widget settings.

params.name: bindingContext
params.description: The current binding context.

classitems.description: Installs the widget module by adding the widget binding handler and optionally registering kinds.
classitems.name: install

params.name: config
params.description: The module config. Add a `kinds` array with the names of widgets to automatically register. You can also specify a `bindingName` if you wish to use another name for the widget binding, such as "control" for example.
